description: From duck +‎ weed. Supposedly so-named for often being consumed by ducks and other waterfowl. Compare Middle English dokemete (“duckweed”, literally “duck-food”).

nouns.description: duckweed (countable and uncountable, plural duckweeds or duckweed)

entries.meaning: Any of several reduced floating aquatic plants in the subfamily Lemnoideae of the family Araceae.
